alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 19 at 7:13PM MST until May 19 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... southern portions of Yavapai County in west central Arizona. * Until 930 PM MST. * At 703 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rainfall across portions of the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Although the heaviest of rainfall has passed, flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly due to continuing runoff. The Flash Flood Warning has been extended in time to account for this continuing runoff. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Congress, Wagoner, Walnut Grove, the Hassayampa River, Antelope Creek, and Martinez Wash. This includes the following highways... Highway 93 between mile markers 183 and 196. State Route 71 between mile markers 99 and 109. State Route 89 between mile markers 258 and 270...and between mile markers 274 and 276. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Antelope Creek, East Antelope Creek, Cellar Springs Creek, Miller Creek, Martinez Creek, Mescal Creek, Weaver Creek, Spring Creek, Yarnell Creek, Middlewater Creek, Hassayampa River, Minnehaha Creek, Blind Indian Creek, Cherry Creek, Hamlin Wash, Oak Creek, Ash Creek, Slim Jim Creek, Kirkland Creek, North Fork Cellar Springs Creek, Dead Mexican Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Milk Creek, Amazon Gulch, Martinez Wash, Arrastre Creek and Sols Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
